arm_group.description: Standard therapy group with nephrostomy tube and double J stent left at the end of the PCNL
Double J stent only left at the end of the procedure

brief_summary.textblock:
Comparison of complications between standard upper pole percutaneous nephrolithotomy (PCNL)
      with nephrostomy placement and double J stent and PCNL with double J placement only without
      nephrostomy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tubeless Versus Standard Upper Pole Percutaneous Nephrolithotomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients undergoing upper pole percutaneous nephrolithotomy older than 18 years of
             age and willing to participate

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients younger than 18 years of age

          -  Patients unwilling to participate in the study

          -  Patients that nephrostomy tube placement was a preequisite at the end of the
             procedure

intervention.description: Double J stent only left at the end of the procedure without placement of a nephrostomy tube

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Complications Between Patients Undergoing Standard Percutaneous Nephrolithotomy With Nephrostomy Tube Placement and Tubeless Percutaneous Nephrolithotomy With Double J Stent Only Placement

primary_outcome.description: Assessment and comparison of pleural effusion incidence between patients in both groups
primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with pleural effusion

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment and comparison of pain by a visual analog scale between patients in both groups.
secondary_outcome.measure: Pain score on visual analog scale

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
